events.originalText: President George W. Bush signed the Patriot Act into law (pictured), significantly expanding the authority of United States law enforcement agencies.
events.subtitle: George W. Bush
events.headline: President George W. Bush signs Patriot Act into law

events.originalText: Following protests against military leader Robert Guéï, Laurent Gbagbo became the president of Ivory Coast.
events.subtitle: Robert Guéï
events.headline: Laurent Gbagbo becomes president of Ivory Coast

events.originalText: Somali hospital cook Ali Maow Maalin began displaying symptoms of smallpox, becoming the last person known to be naturally infected by the disease.
events.subtitle: Ali Maow Maalin
events.headline: Last person infected with smallpox identified as Somali hospital cook

events.originalText: Ngô Đình Diệm proclaimed himself president of the newly created Republic of Vietnam after defeating former emperor Bảo Đại in a fraudulent referendum supervised by his brother Ngô Đình Nhu.
events.subtitle: Ngo Dinh Diem
events.headline: Ngô Đình Diệm proclaims himself president of Republic of Vietnam

events.originalText: The first buildings in the sacred Oyasato-yakata complex of the Japanese new religious movement Tenrikyo in Tenri, Nara, were completed.
events.subtitle: Tenrikyo Church Headquarters
events.headline: First buildings completed in Tenrikyo complex in Tenri, Nara

events.originalText: The Chicago Theatre (pictured), the oldest surviving grand movie palace, opened.
events.subtitle: Chicago Theatre
events.headline: Oldest grand movie palace, Chicago Theatre, opens

events.originalText: The Saint Petersburg Soviet held its first meeting, becoming the first elected body in Russia to represent workers.
events.subtitle: Saint Petersburg Soviet
events.headline: Saint Petersburg Soviet holds first meeting

events.originalText: A group of Russian explorers led by Baron von Toll left their camp on Bennett Island and disappeared without a trace.
events.subtitle: Eduard von Toll
events.headline: Russian explorers led by Baron von Toll disappear without a trace

events.originalText: Ida B. Wells (pictured) began to publish her research on lynching in the United States, for which she was posthumously awarded a Pulitzer Prize in 2020.
events.subtitle: Ida B. Wells
events.headline: Ida B. Wells publishes research on lynching in the United States

events.originalText: Liberian president Edward James Roye (pictured) was overthrown in modern Africa's first coup d'état.
events.subtitle: Edward James Roye
events.headline: Liberian president Edward James Roye overthrown in first modern Africa coup

events.originalText: War of 1812: British forces and Mohawk allies under Charles de Salaberry repulsed an American attempt to invade Canada.
events.subtitle: War of 1812
events.headline: British forces and Mohawk allies repel American invasion attempt in War of 1812

events.originalText: Japanese invasions of Korea: Thirteen Korean ships commanded by Admiral Yi Sun-sin defeated a far larger Japanese invading fleet at the Battle of Myeongnyang in the Myeongnyang Strait.
events.subtitle: Japanese invasions of Korea (1592–1598)
events.headline: Admiral Yi Sun-sin defeats Japanese fleet at Battle of Myeongnyang

events.originalText: The Byzantine army proclaimed chief minister John VI Kantakouzenos emperor, triggering a civil war between his supporters and those of John V Palaiologos, the heir to the throne.
events.subtitle: Byzantine Empire
events.headline: Civil war triggered as Byzantine army proclaims John VI Kantakouzenos emperor
